channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Sound of Music
channel.desc: Classic film version of the Rodgers and Hammerstein musical in which a novice nun leaves her convent to accept a position as governess to a large family.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Julie Andrews
channel.desc: A retrospective look at television appearances made over the years by Mary Poppins and Sound of Music star Julie Andrews, with interviews from the archive and classic clips.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Gillian Anderson
channel.desc: Actor Gillian Anderson talks to John Wilson about her most significant creative influences and experiences.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Viceroy's House
channel.desc: Period drama. Lord Mountbatten arrives in India to take the post of last viceroy. A new servant arrives to work as one of Mountbatten's dressers, only to encounter a long-lost love.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Jet Stream and Us
channel.desc: Documentary tracing how understanding of the powerful and changing weather phenomenon that is the jet stream - a ribbon of fast-moving air high in the atmosphere - has grown.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 17 July 1998 and featuring Billie, Celine Dion and The Bee Gees, Eagle-Eye Cherry, Garbage and Another Level.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Mike Read presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 1 October 1981 and featuring The Tweets, Altered Images, Gidea Park, The Creatures, Dollar and Adam and the Ants.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Mark Franklin and Claudia Simon present the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 1 October 1992 and featuring Stereo MC's, Crowded House, Doctor Spin, Dr. Alban, and Bob Marley and the Wailers.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Country Kings at the BBC
channel.desc: Performances by The Everly Brothers, Jerry Lee Lewis, Garth Brooks, Willie Nelson, Glen Campbell, Charley Pride, George Hamilton IV, Kenny Rogers, Clint Black and Johnny Cash.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Kenny Rogers in Concert
channel.desc: Country music icon Kenny Rogers stars in a television special from 1979, recorded during a visit to England. He is joined by pop-country vocal group Dave & Sugar.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Tammy
channel.desc: Country music star Tammy Wynette sings her favourite songs and introduces fellow Nashville star George Hamilton IV at The Maltings in Suffolk.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Old Grey Whistle Test Special
channel.desc: Innovative country legend Emmylou Harris and The Hot Band perform in a special concert recorded for The Old Grey Whistle Test in 1977.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Emmylou Harris
channel.desc: Profile of veteran country singer Emmylou Harris, witnessing the heady success of her career, while discussing her late flowering of intensely personal and groundbreaking music.

channel.title: The Flying Gardener
channel.desc: Chris Beardshaw travels around by helicopter to find Britain's most inspirational gardens. In the Lake District, Chris goes in search of the ultimate water feature.

channel.desc: Siegfried is determined to make the errant farmers pay their bills.

channel.title: All Creatures Great and Small
channel.desc: Siegfried gives a friend's offspring some experience in the surgery. Calum resents this until he sees the young student.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Rosalie
channel.desc: France, 1870. Rosalie is a young woman with a secret. she was born with a face and body covered in hair. She has kept her secret safe all her life, but she no longer wishes to hide.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Parkinson
channel.desc: Michael Parkinson in conversation with Julie Andrews and Blake Edwards. From 1974.

channel.title: Madhur Jaffrey's Flavours of India
channel.desc: Madhur visits the Punjab, where she reveals the secrets of tandoori cooking.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Desi DNA
channel.desc: A report on the spiritual side of LA, how Bangladeshis have injected vibrancy into London's East End and music from Nina Jayne. With Nihal Arthanayake, Anita Rani and Adil Ray.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: South Asian Music at the BBC
channel.desc: To help mark 60 years of Asian broadcasting at the BBC, DJ Bobby Friction shares his love and knowledge of South Asian music with a journey back through the archives.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Goodness Gracious Me
channel.desc: Programme from 2018 that celebrated 20 years since Goodness Gracious Me launched British Asian comedy onto mainstream TV. Ten of its best-loved sketches are put to a viewers' vote.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Meera Syal
channel.desc: Meera Syal takes an affectionate look back at the Asian programmes she grew up watching.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
channel.desc: Fred Dibnah takes a look at mining, touring from Cornwall to Scotland to explore how tin, slate, lead and coal were all extracted from the ground.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Railways
channel.desc: Documentary series about Britain's railways. Liz McIvor examines how the railways enabled people to live further and further from the places where they worked.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Amsterdam
channel.desc: Janina Ramirez and Alastair Sooke discover the art and design of Amsterdam - a city that pioneered much of modern life, from multinational trade to how we design our homes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Call My Bluff
channel.desc: Robert Robinson referees as Frank Muir Anna Massey and Godfrey Smith take on Arthur Marshall Sally Magnusson and Peter Egan in a duel of words and wit.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Face the Music
channel.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against Joyce Grenfell, Robin Ray and Patrick Moore. With guest musician Joan Cross.

channel.title: Billie Holiday
channel.desc: A film portrait of one of the greatest jazz singers of all time, Billie Holiday. Contains very strong language.

channel.title: Marina Abramovic
channel.desc: Performance artist Marina Abramovic talks to Alan Yentob about turning her life into art. Contains some strong language and some upsetting scenes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
channel.desc: Fred Dibnah visits the North East, which is rich in railway history, and gets to ride on the footplate and stoke the boiler of a Black Five at Llangollen Railway.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Railways
channel.desc: Series about Britain's railways. How the railways changed culinary tastes in London, as rapid transport enabled people to enjoy food from across the nation.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Good Life
channel.desc: When Margo buys a spinning wheel at an antique shop, Tom buys a loom so he and Barbara can make their own woollen clothes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Yes, Prime Minister
channel.desc: Jim Hacker considers cancelling the Trident programme after discovering some interesting facts about the UK's defence system.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Henry VIII
channel.desc: Jonathan Foyle looks at the palaces, tapestries, music and paintings created in King Henry VIII's name and asks if they compensate for the religious treasures he later destroyed.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Librarians - Storyville
channel.desc: A Storyville documentary that explores how librarians across the US are risking their safety to defend free speech as book bans and censorship threaten democracy from within.
